elements.title: Signatures of chiral superconductivity in rhombohedral graphene
elements.contents:

elements.title: Unravelling cysteine-deficiency-associated rapid weight loss
elements.contents:
Unravelling cysteine-deficiency-associated rapid weight loss

Conditional cysteine restriction in mice causes substantial weight loss, exceeding that seen with essential amino acid restriction, by activating the integrated stress and oxidative stress responses, and by unexpectedly depleting coenzyme A, leading to metabolic inefficiency.

  • Alan Varghese
  • Ivan Gusarov
  • Evgeny Nudler
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: A retrograde planet in a tight binary star system with a white dwarf
elements.contents:
A retrograde planet in a tight binary star system with a white dwarf

A planet in a retrograde orbit around a star with a close-in white dwarf companion reveals the role of binary stellar evolution in the formation and evolution of planets.

  • Ho Wan Cheng
  • Trifon Trifonov
  • Andreas Quirrenbach
Article21 May 2025

elements.title: Clonal tracing with somatic epimutations reveals dynamics of blood ageing
elements.contents:
Clonal tracing with somatic epimutations reveals dynamics of blood ageing

The discovery that DNA methylation of different CpG sites can serve as digital barcodes of clonal identity led to the development of EPI-Clone, an algorithm that enables single-cell lineage tracing through cellular differentiation at scale.

  • Michael Scherer
  • Indranil Singh
  • Lars Velten
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: Programmable control of spatial transcriptome in live cells and neurons
elements.contents:
Programmable control of spatial transcriptome in live cells and neurons

CRISPR-TO, a system for programmable control of spatial localization of cellular RNAs, is presented and enables functional investigation of endogenous RNA localization in diverse living cells.

  • Mengting Han
  • Maylin L. Fu
  • Lei S. Qi
Article21 May 2025

elements.title: Large gas inflow driven by a matured galactic bar in the early Universe
elements.contents:
Large gas inflow driven by a matured galactic bar in the early Universe

Gas distribution and motion patterns driven by a galactic bar of the J0107a dusty star-forming galaxy have analogues in local bars, indicating that similar processes of active star formation were already operating 11.1 billion years ago.

  • Shuo Huang
  • Ryohei Kawabe
  • Toshiki Saito
Article21 May 2025

elements.title: Quasar radiation transforms the gas in a merging companion galaxy
elements.contents:
Quasar radiation transforms the gas in a merging companion galaxy

We demonstrate that in a major merging system, radiation from the quasar in one galaxy directly alters the gas properties in the companion galaxy.

  • Sergei Balashev
  • Pasquier Noterdaeme
  • Rodrigo Cuellar
Article21 May 2025

elements.title: Closed-loop vagus nerve stimulation aids recovery from spinal cord injury
elements.contents:
Closed-loop vagus nerve stimulation aids recovery from spinal cord injury

Following spinal cord injury, gamified physical therapy that incorporates closed-loop vagus nerve stimulation can aid restoration of arm and hand function.

  • Michael P. Kilgard
  • Joseph D. Epperson
  • Robert L. Rennaker
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: The structure of liquid carbon elucidated by in situ X-ray diffraction
elements.contents:
The structure of liquid carbon elucidated by in situ X-ray diffraction

A precise structure measurement of liquid carbon at pressures of around 1 million atmospheres obtained by in situ X-ray diffraction at an X-ray free-electron laser shows a complex fluid with transient bonding and approximately four nearest neighbours on average.

  • D. Kraus
  • J. Rips
  • M. I. McMahon
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: Glioblastoma-instructed astrocytes suppress tumour-specific T cell immunity
elements.contents:
Glioblastoma-instructed astrocytes suppress tumour-specific T cell immunity

A population of TRAIL-positive astrocytes in glioblastoma contributes to an immunosuppressive tumour microenvironment and this mechanism can be targeted with an engineered oncolytic virus to improve outcomes.

  • Camilo Faust Akl
  • Brian M. Andersen
  • Francisco J. Quintana
Article21 May 2025

elements.title: C-to-N atom swapping and skeletal editing in indoles and benzofurans
elements.contents:
C-to-N atom swapping and skeletal editing in indoles and benzofurans

C to N atom swapping in indoles is introduced that gives indazoles through oxidative cleavage of the indole heteroarene core and subsequent ring closure, adding another method to the field of skeletal editing.

  • Zhe Wang
  • Pengwei Xu
  • Armido Studer
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: Stepwise ATP translocation into the endoplasmic reticulum by human SLC35B1
elements.contents:
Stepwise ATP translocation into the endoplasmic reticulum by human SLC35B1

SLC35B1, initially thought to be a nucleotide sugar transporter, is an essential ATP/ADP exchanger that imports ATP into the endoplasmic reticulum through a unique stepwise translocation mechanism.

  • Ashutosh Gulati
  • Do-Hwan Ahn
  • David Drew
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: A foundation model for the Earth system
elements.contents:
A foundation model for the Earth system

Aurora, a new large-scale foundation model trained on more than one million hours of diverse geophysical data, outperforms operational forecasts in predicting air quality, ocean wave dynamics, tropical cyclone tracks and high-resolution weather.

  • Cristian Bodnar
  • Wessel P. Bruinsma
  • Paris Perdikaris
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: Multigenerational cell tracking of DNA replication and heritable DNA damage
elements.contents:
Multigenerational cell tracking of DNA replication and heritable DNA damage

A multigenerational single-cell tracking approach provides a framework to dissect phenotypic plasticity at the single-cell level, offering insights into cellular processes that may resemble early events during cancer development.

  • Andreas Panagopoulos
  • Merula Stout
  • Matthias Altmeyer
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: Ru and W isotope systematics in ocean island basalts reveals core leakage
elements.contents:
Ru and W isotope systematics in ocean island basalts reveals core leakage

Ru isotopes are proposed as tracers for coremantle interaction on Earth, and anomalies for ocean island basalts from Hawaii are reported that have higher 100Ru than the ambient mantle.

  • Nils Messling
  • Matthias Willbold
  • Dennis Geist
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: Sequence diversity lost in early pregnancy
elements.contents:
Sequence diversity lost in early pregnancy

Around 1 in 136 pregnancies is lost due to a pathogenic small sequence variant genotype in the fetus.

  • Gudny A. Arnadottir
  • Hakon Jonsson
  • Kari Stefansson
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025

elements.title: PCSK9 drives sterol-dependent metastatic organ choice in pancreatic cancer
elements.contents:
PCSK9 drives sterol-dependent metastatic organ choice in pancreatic cancer

PCSK9 regulates low density lipoprotein-cholesterol import and determines organ preference of metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, with PCSK9-low cells metastasizing to the liver and PCSK9-high cells preferring the lung.

  • Gilles Rademaker
  • Grace A. Hernandez
  • Rushika M. Perera
Article21 May 2025

elements.title: Molecular basis of positional memory in limb regeneration
elements.contents:
Molecular basis of positional memory in limb regeneration

A molecular analysis of axolotl limb regeneration has identified a positive genetic circuit that maintains posterior cell identity and can be used to reprogramme anterior cells into posterior cells.

  • L. Otsuki
  • S. A. Plattner
  • E. M. Tanaka
ArticleOpen Access21 May 2025
